demo.title: Schedule a Demo
demo.description: See how VendorTal™ Risk Review can help secure your supply chain and meet federal compliance requirements.

nist.question: How does VendorTal™ Risk Review help with NIST 800-161 compliance?
nist.answer: VendorTal™ Risk Review provides assessment templates, controls mapping, and risk scoring that aligns with NIST SP 800-161 requirements, making it easier for organizations to implement and document their supply chain risk management program.

integration.question: Can VendorTal™ Risk Review integrate with our existing GRC platform?
integration.answer: Yes, VendorTal™ Risk Review offers API integrations with major GRC platforms including ServiceNow, RSA Archer, MetricStream, and more. Our integration guides provide step-by-step instructions.

sbom.question: Does VendorTal™ Risk Review provide SBOM analysis?
sbom.answer: SBOM analysis is available through our partner platform TechnoSoluce at technosoluce.com. VendorTal™ Risk Review focuses on vendor risk management, while TechnoSoluce specializes in software supply chain security including SBOM analysis.

setup.question: How quickly can we get started with VendorTal™ Risk Review?
setup.answer: Most customers can begin using the platform within a day. Our onboarding process includes guidance and the platform is designed for straightforward setup.

services.question: Does VendorTal™ Risk Review offer professional services?
services.answer: Yes, we offer professional services for customers who need help with implementation, customization, or creating custom assessment templates for specific industries or compliance requirements.

security.question: What security certifications does VendorTal™ Risk Review have?
security.answer: VendorTal™ Risk Review implements security measures designed to support SOC 2 Type II and FedRAMP compliance requirements. We use industry-standard security practices to protect your data.

cta.title: Ready to secure your supply chain?
cta.description: Get started with VendorTal™ Risk Review today and access tools designed to support NIST SP 800-161 compliance efforts.

section1.title: 1. Introduction
section1.paragraph1: VendorTal™ Risk Review ("we", "our", or "us") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you visit our website vendortal.com, use our platform, or use our mobile application (collectively, the "Services").
section1.paragraph2: Please read this Privacy Policy carefully. If you do not agree with the terms of this Privacy Policy, please do not access the Services. By accessing or using our Services, you consent to the collection, use, and storage of your information as outlined in this Privacy Policy.
section1.paragraph3: We reserve the right to make changes to this Privacy Policy at any time and for any reason. We will alert you about any changes by updating the "Last updated" date of this Privacy Policy. You are encouraged to periodically review this Privacy Policy to stay informed of updates.

personalInfo.title: Personal Information
personalInfo.description: We may collect personal information that you voluntarily provide to us when you register on the Services, express an interest in obtaining information about us or our products and Services, participate in activities on the Services, or otherwise contact us. The personal information we collect may include:

items.contact: Name, email address, telephone number, and contact or authentication data
items.billing: Billing address, payment information, and financial data
items.other: Other information you choose to provide

automaticData.title: Data Collected Automatically
automaticData.description: We automatically collect certain information when you visit, use, or navigate the Services. This information does not reveal your specific identity but may include:

items.device: Device and usage information, such as your IP address, browser and device characteristics, operating system, language preferences, referring URLs, device name, country, location, and information about how and when you use our Services
items.tracking: Information collected through cookies, pixel tags, and other tracking technologies

thirdParty.title: Information from Third Parties
thirdParty.description: We may collect information about you from third-party sources, such as public databases, joint marketing partners, social media platforms, and other third parties. Examples of the information we receive from other sources include social media profile information, marketing leads, and search results and links, including paid listings.

section3.title: 3. How We Use Your Information
section3.description: We use the information we collect for various business purposes, including:

items.provide: To provide, operate, and maintain our Services
items.improve: To improve, personalize, and expand our Services
items.understand: To understand and analyze how you use our Services
items.develop: To develop new products, services, features, and functionality
items.communicate: To communicate with you, including for customer service, updates, and marketing purposes
items.process: To process your transactions and manage your account
items.fraud: To find and prevent fraud, and respond to trust and safety issues
items.compliance: For compliance, legal process, and law enforcement purposes

section4.title: 4. Sharing Your Information
section4.description: We may share your information in the following situations:

serviceProviders.title: Service Providers
serviceProviders.description: We may share your information with third-party vendors, service providers, contractors, or agents who perform services for us or on our behalf.

businessTransfers.title: Business Transfers
businessTransfers.description: We may share or transfer your information in connection with, or during negotiations of, any merger, sale of company assets, financing, or acquisition of all or a portion of our business to another company.

affiliates.title: Affiliates
affiliates.description: We may share your information with our affiliates, in which case we will require those affiliates to honor this Privacy Policy.

businessPartners.title: Business Partners
businessPartners.description: We may share your information with our business partners to offer you certain products, services, or promotions.

consent.title: With Your Consent
consent.description: We may disclose your information for any other purpose with your consent.

otherUsers.title: Other Users
otherUsers.description: When you share personal information or otherwise interact with public areas of the Services, such information may be viewed by all users and may be publicly distributed.

section5.title: 5. Security of Your Information
section5.description: We use administrative, technical, and physical security measures to help protect your personal information from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure. These include:

items.encryption: Encryption of sensitive data at rest and in transit
items.assessments: Regular security assessments and penetration testing
items.physical: Physical security of our data centers and offices

section5.disclaimer: While we have implemented reasonable security measures, please understand that no security system is impenetrable, and we cannot guarantee the absolute security of our databases, nor can we guarantee that information you supply will not be intercepted while being transmitted over the Internet.

section6.title: 6. Your Privacy Rights
section6.description: Depending on your location, you may have the following rights regarding your personal information:

access.title: Right to Access
access.description: You may request to review the personal information we have collected about you.

rectification.title: Right to Rectification
rectification.description: You may request that we correct any inaccurate or incomplete personal information.

erasure.title: Right to Erasure
erasure.description: You may request the deletion of your personal information, subject to certain exceptions.

restrict.title: Right to Restrict Processing
restrict.description: You may request that we restrict the processing of your information under certain circumstances.

portability.title: Right to Data Portability
portability.description: You may request a copy of your personal information in a structured, machine-readable format.

object.title: Right to Object
object.description: You may object to our processing of your personal information in certain circumstances.

section6.exercise: To exercise these rights, please contact us using the contact information provided at the end of this Privacy Policy. We will respond to your request within a reasonable timeframe.

section7.title: 7. Cookies and Tracking Technologies
section7.paragraph1: We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to collect and use information about you, including to serve interest-based advertising. Cookies are small data files placed on your device. We use both session cookies (which expire once you close your web browser) and persistent cookies (which stay on your device until you delete them).
section7.paragraph2: You can set your browser to refuse all or some browser cookies, or to alert you when cookies are being sent. However, if you disable or refuse cookies, please note that some parts of the Services may be inaccessible or not function properly.

section8.title: 8. Children's Privacy
section8.paragraph1: Our Services are not intended for use by children under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 18. If you are under 18, do not use or provide any information on our Services. If we learn we have collected or received personal information from a child under 18 without verification of parental consent, we will delete that information.

section9.title: 9. International Data Transfers
section9.paragraph1: We are based in the United States and process data both inside and outside of the United States. If you are accessing our Services from outside the United States, please be aware that your information may be transferred to, stored, and processed by us in our facilities and by our third-party service providers in the United States and other countries.
section9.paragraph2: If you are a resident of the European Economic Area (EEA), we ensure that your data is protected when transferred outside of the EEA. We rely on mechanisms such as standard contractual clauses, Privacy Shield certification, or other lawful means to transfer data internationally.

section10.title: 10. Data Retention
section10.description: We will retain your personal information only for as long as is necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy. We will retain and use your information to the extent necessary to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our policies. When we no longer need your personal information, we will securely delete or anonymize it.

section11.title: 11. Contact Us
section11.description: If you have questions or comments about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:

section1.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
section1.paragraph1: These Terms of Service ("Terms") govern your use of VendorTal™ Risk Review ("Service") operated by ERMITS LLC ("us", "we", or "our"). By accessing or using our Service, you agree to be bound by these Terms.
section1.paragraph2: If you disagree with any part of these terms, then you may not access the Service. These Terms apply to all visitors, users, and others who access or use the Service.
section1.paragraph3: We reserve the right to update, change or replace any part of these Terms of Service by posting updates and/or changes to our website. It is your responsibility to check this page periodically for changes.

section2.title: 2. Service Description
section2.description: VendorTal™ Risk Review provides supply chain risk management tools and services including:

items.assessment: Supply chain risk assessment tools designed to support NIST SP 800-161 compliance efforts
items.riskMonitoring: Real-time vendor risk monitoring and threat intelligence
items.vendor: Vendor risk management and monitoring capabilities
items.reporting: Risk reporting and compliance documentation tools
items.api: Application Programming Interface (API) for integration with third-party systems

disclaimer.title: Important Disclaimer
disclaimer.text: VendorTal™ Risk Review provides tools and frameworks to support your compliance efforts, but does not guarantee compliance with any regulatory requirements. Users are responsible for ensuring their own compliance with applicable laws and regulations. All assessments and recommendations should be reviewed by qualified professionals.

section3.title: 3. User Responsibilities
section3.description: As a user of our Service, you agree to:

items.accurate: Provide accurate and complete information when using our services
items.compliance: Ensure your use of the Service complies with all applicable laws and regulations
items.security: Maintain the security of your account credentials and notify us of any unauthorized access
items.professional: Use professional judgment when interpreting assessment results and recommendations
items.unauthorized: Not use the Service for any unlawful or unauthorized purpose

section4.title: 4. Prohibited Uses
section4.description: You may not use our Service:

items.illegal: For any unlawful purpose or to solicit others to perform unlawful acts
items.reverse: To reverse engineer, decompile, or disassemble any part of the Service
items.interfere: To interfere with or disrupt the Service or servers connected to the Service
items.violate: To violate any international, federal, provincial, or state regulations, rules, laws, or local ordinances
items.resell: To resell or redistribute the Service without our express written permission

section5.title: 5. Limitation of Liability
section5.description: In no event shall ERMITS LLC, nor its directors, employees, partners, agents, suppliers, or affiliates, be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, including without limitation, loss of profits, data, use, goodwill, or other intangible losses, resulting from your use of the Service.

disclaimer.title: No Warranties
disclaimer.text: The Service is provided on an "AS IS" and "AS AVAILABLE" basis. We make no representations or warranties of any kind, express or implied, as to the operation of the Service or the information, content, materials, or products included on the Service.

section6.title: 6. Termination
section6.description: We may terminate or suspend your account and bar access to the Service immediately, without prior notice or liability, under our sole discretion, for any reason whatsoever and without limitation, including but not limited to a breach of the Terms.

items.termination: We may terminate your access to the Service at any time
items.suspension: We may suspend your account if you violate these Terms
items.effect: Upon termination, your right to use the Service will cease immediately

section7.title: 7. Contact Information
section7.description: If you have any questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us:
section7.contact: ERMITS LLC, Gaithersburg, MD. Email: legal@vendortal.com

section8.title: 8. Governing Law
section8.description: These Terms shall be interpreted and governed by the laws of the State of Maryland, United States, without regard to its conflict of law provisions.
section8.governing: Our failure to enforce any right or provision of these Terms will not be considered a waiver of those rights.

page.title: About VendorTal™ Risk Review
page.subtitle: We're on a mission to make supply chain security accessible, actionable, and provide tools that support federal compliance standards for organizations of all sizes.

story.title: Our Story
story.paragraph1: VendorTal™ Risk Review was founded in 2023 by a team of cybersecurity and supply chain experts who recognized the critical need for better tools to manage third-party risk, especially for organizations working with federal contracts.
story.paragraph2: After years of helping organizations manually implement NIST SP 800-161 controls and struggling with spreadsheets and disconnected tools, we decided to build a comprehensive platform that makes supply chain risk management accessible, effective, and provides tools to support federal compliance requirements.
story.paragraph3: Today, VendorTal™ Risk Review helps organizations of all sizes assess, monitor, and mitigate risks across their supply chain with powerful tools designed to support NIST SP 800-161 compliance efforts.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To secure the digital supply chain by making enterprise-grade security assessments accessible to all organizations and providing tools that support federal compliance requirements.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: A world where organizations can confidently manage their supply chain risks with tools that are powerful yet simple to use, enabling them to focus on innovation while maintaining security and compliance.

security.title: Security First
security.description: We believe in security by design, not as an afterthought. This principle guides our product development and our company operations.

excellence.title: Excellence
excellence.description: We strive for excellence in all we do, from our product quality to customer support, and maintaining the highest standards.

integrity.title: Integrity
integrity.description: We build trust through transparency, honest communication, and always doing what's right for our customers and partners.

nistAlignment.title: NIST Alignment
nistAlignment.description: Our platform is built specifically to support NIST SP 800-161 compliance efforts, making it ideal for federal contractors and organizations working with government agencies.

federalExperience.title: Federal Experience
federalExperience.description: Founded by leaders with extensive experience working with federal agencies and contractors on supply chain security challenges.

comprehensiveSolution.title: Comprehensive Solution
comprehensiveSolution.description: From vendor assessments to SBOM analysis and risk dashboards, we provide all the tools you need for effective supply chain risk management.

apiFirst.title: API-First Architecture
apiFirst.description: Our API-first approach allows for seamless integration with your existing systems, workflows, and security tools.

careers.title: Join Our Team
careers.subtitle: We're always looking for talented individuals who are passionate about security, supply chain risk management, and building great products.

securityEngineer.description: Help build and secure our platform with a focus on supply chain security best practices.

customerSuccess.description: Help customers implement and get the most out of our supply chain risk management tools.

is1.question: Do you have documented information security policies?
is1.guidance: Organizations should maintain current, documented information security policies that address supply chain risks

is2.question: Are security requirements included in vendor contracts?
is2.guidance: All vendor agreements should include specific security requirements and compliance obligations

is3.question: Do you conduct regular security assessments of vendors?
is3.guidance: Regular security assessments help identify and mitigate evolving risks in your supply chain

is4.question: Is sensitive data classification and handling documented?
is4.guidance: Clear data classification and handling procedures ensure appropriate protection throughout the supply chain

supplier.description: Evaluate supplier onboarding, monitoring, and management processes

sr1.question: Do you have a formal supplier onboarding process?
sr1.guidance: A structured onboarding process ensures all suppliers meet minimum security requirements before engagement

sr2.question: Are supplier security capabilities regularly reviewed?
sr2.guidance: Regular reviews help ensure suppliers maintain adequate security posture throughout the relationship

sr3.question: Do you maintain an approved supplier list?
sr3.guidance: An approved supplier list helps control which vendors can access your systems and data

sr4.question: Are supplier termination procedures documented?
sr4.guidance: Clear termination procedures ensure secure offboarding and protection of organizational assets

vulnerability.title: Vulnerability Management
vulnerability.description: Assess vulnerability identification, tracking, and remediation processes

vm1.question: Do you have a vulnerability management program?
vm1.guidance: A comprehensive vulnerability management program is essential for maintaining security across the supply chain

vm2.question: Are vulnerabilities tracked and prioritized?
vm2.guidance: Systematic tracking and prioritization ensures critical vulnerabilities are addressed promptly

vm3.question: Do you require vulnerability disclosure from suppliers?
vm3.guidance: Suppliers should be required to disclose known vulnerabilities in their products and services

vm4.question: Are patch management processes documented?
vm4.guidance: Clear patch management processes help ensure timely remediation of identified vulnerabilities

incident.title: Incident Response
incident.description: Evaluate incident response capabilities and supply chain coordination

ir1.question: Do you have an incident response plan?
ir1.guidance: A comprehensive incident response plan should address supply chain-related security incidents

ir2.question: Are suppliers required to report security incidents?
ir2.guidance: Suppliers should be contractually obligated to report security incidents that may affect your organization

ir3.question: Do you conduct incident response exercises?
ir3.guidance: Regular exercises help ensure your team is prepared to respond effectively to supply chain incidents

ir4.question: Are lessons learned documented and shared?
ir4.guidance: Documenting and sharing lessons learned helps improve future incident response capabilities

threat.title: Threat Management
threat.description: Assess threat intelligence and supply chain threat awareness capabilities

tm1.question: Do you have access to threat intelligence?
tm1.guidance: Current threat intelligence helps organizations understand and prepare for supply chain threats

tm2.question: Are supply chain threats regularly assessed?
tm2.guidance: Regular threat assessments help identify emerging risks in your supply chain

tm3.question: Do you share threat information with suppliers?
tm3.guidance: Sharing relevant threat information helps suppliers better protect your organization

tm4.question: Are threat hunting activities conducted?
tm4.guidance: Proactive threat hunting helps identify advanced threats that may have bypassed traditional defenses

lifecycle.title: Lifecycle Management
lifecycle.description: Evaluate product and service lifecycle security management

sl1.question: Are security requirements defined for the entire lifecycle?
sl1.guidance: Security should be considered throughout the entire product or service lifecycle

sl2.question: Do you conduct security reviews at lifecycle milestones?
sl2.guidance: Regular security reviews at key milestones help ensure continued security posture

sl3.question: Are end-of-life procedures documented?
sl3.guidance: Clear end-of-life procedures ensure secure disposal or decommissioning of products and services

sl4.question: Do you track product and service dependencies?
sl4.guidance: Understanding dependencies helps identify potential single points of failure in your supply chain

sbom.title: SBOM Analysis (Available at TechnoSoluce)
sbom.description: SBOM analysis is available through our partner platform TechnoSoluce at technosoluce.com. VendorTal™ Risk Review focuses on vendor risk management.

componentAnalysis.title: Component Analysis
componentAnalysis.description: Comprehensive analysis of software components, dependencies, and their security posture.

vulnerabilityDetection.title: Vulnerability Detection
vulnerabilityDetection.description: Identify known vulnerabilities in your software components with detailed risk assessments.

licenseCompliance.title: License Compliance
licenseCompliance.description: Track open source licenses and ensure compliance with organizational policies.

upload.title: Upload SBOM
upload.uploadPrompt: Upload a Software Bill of Materials file to begin analysis. We support SPDX, CycloneDX, and other standard formats.

results.title: Analysis Results
results.immediateAction: Immediate action required: {{count}} critical vulnerabilities found
results.goodPosture: Good security posture. Continue monitoring for new vulnerabilities.
results.reviewComponents: Review components with vulnerabilities and consider updates.

aboutSBOM.title: About SBOM Analysis
aboutSBOM.sbomDescription: A Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) is a formal record containing the details and supply chain relationships of various components used in building software. It provides transparency into software composition and enables effective vulnerability management.

benefits.trackLicenses: Track open source licenses for compliance

aboutSBOM.nistDescription: Our SBOM analysis aligns with NIST SP 800-161 supply chain risk management practices, helping organizations meet federal compliance requirements.

helpSection.title: Need Help Getting Started?
helpSection.description: Learn more about SBOM implementation and download templates to get started.

vendorRisk.title: Vendor Risk Management
vendorRisk.description: Comprehensive vendor risk assessment and monitoring platform

workflows.title: Workflow Automation
workflows.description: Automate your vendor risk management processes

threatIntelligence.title: Threat Intelligence
threatIntelligence.description: Monitor security threats affecting your vendors

exportReport.title: Export Analytics Report
exportReport.description: Generate a comprehensive report of your analytics insights

alerts.workflowCreation: Workflow creation would open here. This feature allows you to create custom automation rules for vendor risk management.
alerts.automationManagement: Automation management interface would open here. Configure triggers, actions, and notification settings.

riskScoring.title: Risk Scoring
riskScoring.description: Automated risk scoring based on multiple factors

lowRisk.title: Low Risk Vendors
lowRisk.description: Continue regular monitoring and annual assessments

mediumRisk.title: Medium Risk Vendors
mediumRisk.description: Increase monitoring frequency and require additional security controls

highRisk.title: High Risk Vendors
highRisk.description: Implement immediate remediation plan and enhanced oversight

criticalRisk.title: Critical Risk Vendors
criticalRisk.description: Consider termination or require immediate security improvements

accountPrompt.title: Create an account to save your results
accountPrompt.description: Sign up for a free account to save your assessment results, track progress over time, and access additional features.

supplyChainRecommendations.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Recommendations
supplyChainRecommendations.subtitle: Prioritized recommendations to improve your supply chain security posture

search.placeholder: Search recommendations by title, description, or category...

emptyState.tryDifferentFilters: Try adjusting your search terms or filters to find recommendations.

nistChecklist.title: NIST Compliance Checklist
nistChecklist.description: Quick assessment of your NIST SP 800-161 compliance posture
nistChecklist.aboutText1: This checklist provides a high-level assessment of your organization's compliance with NIST SP 800-161 supply chain risk management guidelines.
nistChecklist.aboutText2: Complete all items to get an overall compliance score and recommendations for improvement.
nistChecklist.instructions: Check each item that your organization has implemented
nistChecklist.compliantMessage: Your organization shows good alignment with NIST SP 800-161 guidelines. However, this is a preliminary assessment and should be followed by comprehensive evaluation.
nistChecklist.nonCompliantMessage: Several areas require attention to improve compliance posture. This assessment is for informational purposes only and should be followed by professional evaluation.

items.scrm1: Supply chain risk management policy established
items.scrm5: Incident response plan includes supply chain
items.scrm10: Staff training on supply chain risks

riskCalculator.title: Vendor Risk Calculator
riskCalculator.description: Calculate vendor risk scores based on multiple factors
riskCalculator.disclaimer: This is a preliminary assessment tool for informational purposes only. Results should not be considered as definitive risk evaluations or compliance determinations. For critical vendors, conduct comprehensive assessments and consult with qualified professionals. VendorTal™ Risk Review makes no warranties regarding the accuracy or completeness of assessment results.

criticality.name: Business Criticality
criticality.description: How critical is this vendor to your business operations?

dataAccess.name: Data Access Level
dataAccess.description: What level of sensitive data does this vendor access?

systemExposure.name: System Exposure
systemExposure.description: How much access does this vendor have to your systems?

compliance.name: Compliance Status
compliance.description: What is the vendor's compliance posture?

securityControls.name: Security Controls
securityControls.description: How robust are the vendor's security controls?

results.medium: Implement enhanced monitoring and additional controls
results.high: Require immediate remediation and enhanced oversight
results.critical: Consider contract termination or emergency security measures

sbomScan.title: SBOM Scanner
sbomScan.description: Quick scan of your Software Bill of Materials
sbomScan.formatInfo: Supports SPDX, CycloneDX, and SWID formats
sbomScan.disclaimer: SBOM analysis results are provided for informational purposes only. Vulnerability data is sourced from public databases and may not be complete or current. Users should verify findings and consult with security professionals for critical decisions. VendorTal™ Risk Review makes no warranties regarding the accuracy or completeness of vulnerability assessments.

step3.description: Start your first supply chain risk assessment

cta.title: Ready to Get Started?
cta.subtitle: Join organizations managing supply chain risk

freeTrial.question: Do you offer a free trial?
freeTrial.answer: Yes, we offer a 14-day free trial with full access to all starter features.

dataSecure.question: How secure is my data?
dataSecure.answer: We use enterprise-grade security with encryption at rest and in transit, SOC 2 compliance, and regular security audits.

supportIncluded.question: What support is included?
supportIncluded.answer: All plans include email support. Professional and Enterprise plans include priority support and dedicated customer success.

changePlans.question: Can I change plans anytime?
changePlans.answer: Yes, you can upgrade or downgrade your plan at any time. Changes take effect at your next billing cycle.

customIntegrations.question: Do you support custom integrations?
customIntegrations.answer: Enterprise plans include custom integrations. Professional plans have API access for self-service integrations.

paymentMethods.question: What payment methods do you accept?
paymentMethods.answer: We accept all major credit cards, ACH transfers, and can accommodate purchase orders for Enterprise customers.

securityTips.clientSide: Never expose API keys in client-side code

endpointDescriptions.getControl: Get detailed information about a specific control

sbomApi.description: Analyze and manage Software Bills of Materials

vendorRiskApi.description: Manage vendor assessments and risk scores

integrationGuides.title: Integration Guides
integrationGuides.description: Connect VendorTal™ Risk Review with your existing systems and workflows. Follow our step-by-step guides to integrate supply chain risk management into your technology stack.

quickStart.title: Getting Started with VendorTal™ Risk Review API
quickStart.description: New to VendorTal™ Risk Review integrations? Start with our REST API guide to understand the basics of authentication, endpoints, and data formats.

restApi.title: REST API Integration
restApi.description: Connect your applications to VendorTal™ Risk Review using our REST API for vendor data, assessments, and SBOM analysis.
steps: Obtain API credentials from your VendorTal™ Risk Review dashboard
Set up authentication headers in your application
Make your first API call to fetch vendor data
Implement error handling and rate limiting
Test the integration with sample data

webhookSetup.title: Webhook Configuration
webhookSetup.description: Receive real-time notifications when vendor risk scores change, assessments complete, or vulnerabilities are detected.
steps: Configure webhook endpoints in your VendorTal™ Risk Review dashboard
Set up a secure HTTPS endpoint to receive webhooks
Verify webhook signatures for security
Handle different event types (risk changes, assessments)
Implement retry logic for failed webhook deliveries

ssoIntegration.title: Single Sign-On (SSO)
ssoIntegration.description: Integrate VendorTal™ Risk Review with your organization's identity provider using SAML 2.0 or OpenID Connect.
steps: Configure your identity provider (IdP) settings
Exchange SAML metadata with VendorTal™ Risk Review
Set up attribute mapping for user roles
Test SSO login flow with test users
Configure group-based access controls

dataExport.title: Automated Data Export
dataExport.description: Set up scheduled exports of vendor data, assessment results, and compliance reports to your data warehouse.
steps: Choose your preferred export format (CSV, JSON, XML)
Configure export schedules in the dashboard
Set up secure file transfer (SFTP, S3, etc.)
Map data fields to your internal systems
Test the export process and validate data

workflowAutomation.title: Workflow Automation
workflowAutomation.description: Automate vendor onboarding, risk assessments, and compliance tracking using VendorTal™ Risk Review APIs.
steps: Design your automation workflow
Set up trigger conditions (new vendor, risk threshold)
Configure automated actions (send assessments, alerts)
Implement approval workflows for high-risk vendors
Monitor and optimize automation performance

cloudIntegration.title: Cloud Platform Integration
cloudIntegration.description: Connect VendorTal™ Risk Review with AWS, Azure, or GCP for enhanced security monitoring and compliance.
steps: Set up cloud service credentials and permissions
Configure VendorTal™ Risk Review cloud connectors
Map cloud resources to vendor relationships
Enable automated compliance monitoring
Set up alerting for security events

javascript.description: Official JavaScript/TypeScript SDK for web and Node.js applications.

python.title: Python SDK
python.description: Python library for data science and automation workflows.

cli.description: Command-line interface for batch operations and CI/CD integration.
